$interpreted: Karen: Where is His Majesty?
Bodyguard: Things have changed. Right now, His Majesty thinks that showing himself in public is not a wise decision.
Karen: Then, did His Majesty asked you to inform me of my next mission?
Bodyguard: His Majesty said nothing.
Karen: ...His Majesty Theodore has been seeing no one.
Karen: I wonder if he's given up on the throne.
Bodyguard: Don't think you have the authority to interpret His Majesty Theodore's actions on your own.
Bodyguard: In any case, go back and wait for a message. Don't do anything that may attract attention. Don't come back unless there's an issue.
Karen: Don't come back unless there's an issue...so that means if there's a reason to come back, do so.
Karen: It's you...you followed me!?
Wily Merchant: The desert bandits I hired reported your location to me. Although I don't know what the chamber president is doing sneaking around out here,
Wily Merchant: I don't see any signs of life. A perfect place to get rid of you!
Karen: How could I make such a simple mistake...?
Wily Merchant: Slaughter her!
Karen: DIE! Anyone that knows my secret must die!
Karen: These bandits are just being used as mere tools. Why would they be willing to sacrifice themselves for their work?
Wily Merchant: S..s..so..sorry. Forgive me...please...
Karen: Do you know why I wasn't mad at you for what you said to me during the day?
Wily Merchant: W-Why?
Karen: First, I don't care. Not one bit at all.
Karen: Second, it is because of my scales that I get to approach the lizards more easily, and that's why His Majesty Theodore sent me here.
Wily Merchant: Theodore! You're working for Theodore!?
Karen: I'm just a pawn, placed in a particular place so His Majesty Theodore can get what he wants. All to repay him for this life he saved ages ago.
Karen: But you know what? I don't care about that either.
Karen: Do you know why I'm telling you all this? First, if you hold something in long enough, at some point it needs to come out.
Wily Merchant: Let me go! I won't say anything! I promise...oh, wait! No, no...I didn't hear anything! Nothing at all!
Karen: Second, it's a great excuse.
Karen: (What should I do right now, and with which identity?)
Karen: (Since I'm just one of His Majesty Theodore's pawns, there is only one thing to do.)

Model.Text: Where is His Majesty?
Things have changed. Right now, His Majesty thinks that showing himself in public is not a wise decision.
Then, did His Majesty asked you to inform me of my next mission?
His Majesty said nothing.
...His Majesty Theodore has been seeing no one.
I wonder if he's given up on the throne.
Don't think you have the authority to interpret His Majesty Theodore's actions on your own.
In any case, go back and wait for a message. Don't do anything that may attract attention. Don't come back unless there's an issue.
Don't come back unless there's an issue...so that means if there's a reason to come back, do so.
It's you...you followed me!?
The desert bandits I hired reported your location to me. Although I don't know what the chamber president is doing sneaking around out here,
I don't see any signs of life. A perfect place to get rid of you!
How could I make such a simple mistake...?
Slaughter her!
DIE! Anyone that knows my secret must die!
These bandits are just being used as mere tools. Why would they be willing to sacrifice themselves for their work?
S..s..so..sorry. Forgive me...please...
Do you know why I wasn't mad at you for what you said to me during the day?
W-Why?
First, I don't care. Not one bit at all.
Second, it is because of my scales that I get to approach the lizards more easily, and that's why His Majesty Theodore sent me here.
Theodore! You're working for Theodore!?
I'm just a pawn, placed in a particular place so His Majesty Theodore can get what he wants. All to repay him for this life he saved ages ago.
But you know what? I don't care about that either.
Do you know why I'm telling you all this? First, if you hold something in long enough, at some point it needs to come out.
Let me go! I won't say anything! I promise...oh, wait! No, no...I didn't hear anything! Nothing at all!
Second, it's a great excuse.
(What should I do right now, and with which identity?)
(Since I'm just one of His Majesty Theodore's pawns, there is only one thing to do.)
